summary: Richard A. Sprague is mentioned in the documents as being employed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Document 180-10070-10160 specifically mentions his payroll authorizations and salary adjustments. The documents primarily consist of payroll records and related administrative documents concerning HSCA staff. The documents mentioning Sprague are part of a larger collection of payroll records for various HSCA employees, often including payroll authorization forms, salary adjustments, and notifications regarding the postponement of Social Security numbers due to privacy concerns. Sprague's involvement appears to be related to his employment and compensation within the HSCA.
significance: Richard A. Sprague's significance in the JFK context, based on the provided documents, is primarily related to his employment and payroll records within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents suggest he was a staff member whose employment details were part of the committee's administrative records. While the documents confirm his employment, they do not provide specific details about his role or contributions to the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
